column1: Manager - GTL (Corporate Sales) - Multiple Locations - 8 + years
column2: We are looking for a professional coming from an insurance background with at least 8+ years of work experience in selling life insurance to corporates through broking. Someone preferably into  group business sales. Your future employer -  One of the leading insurance service providers playing at a global level.  Responsibilities -  Achieving the regional targets for Group Term Insurance, Retail through the group, and other products launched by the Corporate Solutions team in the assigned region. Assisting in executing the business plan Responsible for achieving sales targets through a select group of brokers Assisting in launching Group Business products Preparing periodic sales reports and presenting products to the Corporates, Affinity Groups, and Associations through brokers. Developing alternate channels to penetrate the Group Business market through brokers and MLI Agents. Updating the Sales process and maintaining the databases as suggested by the department in the region. Requirements - Graduate/ Post-graduate with 4+ years of corporate sales experience in life insurance. Comprehensive understanding of the group term life insurance sales to corporates. Experience in strategizing and executing long-term business strategies.  3 years of project management experience, managing projects across multiple functions. Strong executioner.  Good communication, articulation, and stakeholder management skills.  Reach Us -  Please feel free to reach me at  ankit.sharma@crescendogroup.in  for more details on the opportunity. Disclaimer  Crescendo Global is an ISO 9001:2015 certified, equal opportunity Leadership Hiring consulting firm. Crescendo Global consultants value diversity in the talent they identify for its Global and Fortune 500 clients. Crescendo Global does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Note: We receive a lot of applications on a daily basis so it becomes a bit difficult for us to get back to each candidate. Please assume that your profile has not been shortlisted in case you don't hear back from us in 1 week. Your patience is highly appreciated.  Profile Keywords: Crescendo, Crescendo Global, Sales, Corporate sales, insurance broking, Group Business, Group medical, GTL, Group term life insurance, GTL Sales,  Insurance jobs.

Assist the Head Of Compliance with Internal/External Reviews       Provide support for the enhanced due diligence process followed on high risk relationships prior to account opening and provide decisions according. Review proposals on high risk relationships and ensure that all risks are appropriately highlighted.         Assist occasionally on specific local regulatory/other projects re ad hoc projects, business & compliance initiatives, trouble-shooting and relevant system updates.         Review the eNameChecker referrals from branches/enabling functions/operation and provide Compliance feedback in accordance with the bank policies/ respective regulations       Review the AML/Wolfsberg Questionnaires received from FIs and provide feedback.     Providing support to other compliance staff members in their respective areas as and when required.     Assist the team in garnering a strong compliance driven culture/environment within Business Groups/ Divisions.       Provide support in preparing reports/MIS on issues of Compliance/AML and ensure that same are submitted in a timely manner to HO-Compliance.         Prepare the Regulatory Reports for accuracy and assist to ensure that the same are submitted to the Regulators in a timely manner after being vetted by the relevant Compliance Manager.         Assist the Head Of Compliance in providing seamless support to the relevant regulators any critical issues to be promptly escalated.         Assist in the compliance related projects/UATs as and when required and ensure that they are successfully completed within the required time frame.         Operates in complex environments that are characterized by diverse local and international regulations; thus requiring multi-jurisdictional knowledge.       Familiarity with banking law and practices as we'll as MB policies and procedure and systems.       Working relationship at all levels requires good inter-personal skills and the ability to influence without authority, sell solutions and develop relationships within Bank and Regulatory Authorities.         Analytical thinking and educative judgement are required because of the complex and unique nature of customer / country / regulations / systems or a combination.         Clear understanding of business transactions, initiatives and relationship requirements with close coordination with relationship team without losing focus on risk, regulations and control issues.       Regulatory, compliance and AML requirements coming from various countries would require an understanding of international best practices.       Contribute in the development of product, systems policies and procedures related to compliance and AML at bank-wide level.     Maintain and develop relations with Business Units and other stakeholders.       Responsible for administrative and office support.       Knowledge, Skills and Experience       Around 5-6 years of experience in banking and / or relevant fields, eg law, commerce, risk etc A strong sales/operational background would also be very useful.     Professional qualification/certification in compliance example: ACAMS or AAMLP or CAMLP     Basic understanding of international banking law / practice and products / services.     General overview/knowledge / experience related to compliance / AML / Central Bank regulations.     Ability to plan/organize     Ability to influence & negotiate     Decision making ability     Team player and participation experience in variety of banking initiatives and solutions.     Good decision making ability and administrative and interpersonal skills     Proficiency in Excel and Mircrosoft Office with strong command of written and spoken English.
column11: Administration, Due diligence, Compliance, MIS, Analytical, Banking law, Banking, Operations, Financial services, International banking

column2: Responsibilities:  Develop and implement sales strategies to achieve revenue targets for both call center and online sales channels.  Lead the sales team in identifying and exploiting opportunities in the local market to acquire new business.  Manage the Profit and Loss of the Insurance business segment, ensuring profitability and sustainable growth.  Foster and maintain strong relationships with insurance providers and other key stakeholders.  Drive the introduction and promotion of new insurance products to penetrate and establish them in the market.  Provide guidance, coaching, and support to the sales team to ensure they meet their targets and deliver exceptional customer service.  Ensuring compliance with regulations and procedures as laid down by the IRDA by keeping up to date with all changes in the regulatory framework  Collaborate with other departments, such as operations and underwriting, to streamline processes and enhance post-sales service delivery.   Educational Qualifications & Experience   Required:  Bachelors degree in Business Administration, Marketing, Finance, or related field. MBA Preferred. Minimum 10 years of proven track record of success in sales leadership roles within the insurance industry.   Competencies Required:  Product knowledge  Sales Planning  Negotiating & Closing  Business Acumen  Lead Management  Coaching & Mentorship  Team Management  Leadership  Data Analysis
column11: BPO, Call Center Management, B2C Sales, Insurance Sales, B2B Sales, Banking Voice, Contact Centre

column1: Direct Sales Manager ( Branch Head NPS Channel)
column2: Oversee day-to-day operations of the insurance branch, including customer service, policy administration, claims processing, and underwriting activities     Recruit, train, and supervise branch staff, including sales agents, underwriters, customer service representatives, and administrative personnel     Build and maintain relationships with customers, agents, brokers, and other stakeholders to enhance customer satisfaction and loyalty     Identify growth opportunities and implement initiatives to expand the branchs market share, increase customer base, and improve brand presence     Ensure adherence to regulatory requirements, internal policies, and industry standards. Mitigate risks and resolve any compliance issues that may arise     Monitor branch expenses, budgets, and financial performance     Handle and resolve complaints or grievances raised by NPS subscribers promptly and efficiently     Candidate Qualifications:      Bachelors degree or MBA     Minimum of 10+ years of experience in the Insurance Industry and 2+ Years of Experience as a Branch Manager     Other Direct channel Life Insurance experience is preferred     Team handling experience is mandatory     Excellent communication, presentation, and leadership skills     Career stability     Required Skills:      Strong background in Direct Channel Life Insurance Company as a Branch Manager
column11: Direct sales, Administration, Branch Head, Sales, Customer satisfaction, Underwriting, Finance, Customer service, Claims processing, Monitoring
